testsuite.name: Support Edgescape in SPOC
testsuite.details: In SPOC, we are currently using IP2Location for the IP lookup.  We will use EdgeScape to replace IP2Location in this project.

testsuite.name: Configuration change test cases
testsuite.details: This test suite is going to test all the configration changes that are made to suppport edgescape.

testcase.name: USE_OLD_LOCATION_DB
testcase.summary: USE_OLD_LOCATION_DB in configuration file i.e AppRess.properties, to indicate whether to use EdgeScape for IP lookup or not

step.actions: USE_OLD_LOCATION_DB = true
step.expectedresults: Use ip2loc

step.actions: USE_OLD_LOCATION_DB = false
step.expectedresults: Use EdgeScape

step.actions: USE_OLD_LOCATION_DB is not set in configuration file at all
step.expectedresults: Use EdgeScape

step.actions: USE_OLD_LOCATION_DB = junkvalue
step.expectedresults: Use EdgeScape

step.actions: USE_OLD_LOCATION_DB =
step.expectedresults: Use EdgeScape

testcase.name: EDGESCAPE_HOST
testcase.summary: This entry indicates the IP address or host name of location where the EdgeScape facilitator is located.

step.actions:
EDGESCAPE_HOST = edgescape.internet.sony.tv

and USE_OLD_LOCATION_DB = false
step.expectedresults: Use EdgeScape and work properly

step.actions:
EDGESCAPE_HOST =

and USE_OLD_LOCATION_DB = false
step.expectedresults: SPOC dosent work

step.actions:
EDGESCAPE_HOST = blah.blah.blah.blah

and USE_OLD_LOCATION_DB = false
step.expectedresults: SPOC dosent work

step.actions:
Dont add the label EDGESCAPE_HOST in the configuration file itself

and USE_OLD_LOCATION_DB = false
step.expectedresults: SPOC dosent work

step.actions:
EDGESCAPE_HOST = 10.33.0.29

and USE_OLD_LOCATION_DB = false

 

*Note that this IP address is subject to change without notice. Be sure to verify the actual IP address before running tests.
step.expectedresults: SPOC should work with EdgeScape properly

step.actions:
EDGESCAPE_HOST = 1.1.1.1

and USE_OLD_LOCATION_DB = false
step.expectedresults: SPOC dosent work

testcase.name: EDGESCAPE_PORT
testcase.summary: This entry gives the port number where the EdgeScape Facilitator is listening.

step.actions:
EDGESCAPE_PORT = 2001

and USE_OLD_LOCATION_DB = false
step.expectedresults: SPOC should work properly with EdgeScape

step.actions:
EDGESCAPE_PORT = 

and USE_OLD_LOCATION_DB = false
step.expectedresults: SPOC dosent work

step.actions:
Some value other than default value

EDGESCAPE_PORT = 9999

 and USE_OLD_LOCATION_DB = false
step.expectedresults: SPOC dosent work

step.actions:
Remove EDGESCAPE_PORT from configuration file completely

 and USE_OLD_LOCATION_DB = false
step.expectedresults: SPOC should work properly with EdgeScape

testcase.name: EDGESCAPE_TIMEOUT_MS
testcase.summary: This entry defines the time out in millisecond for EdgeScape API call.

step.actions: Work with ERIC to test this

testcase.name: No fall back to ip2location
testcase.summary: No fall back to IP2Location in case Edgescape configuration is missing or query times out

step.actions: If any of the edgscape configuration is missing
step.expectedresults: SPOC should not fall back to IP2location

step.actions: If query times out
step.expectedresults: SPOC should not fall back to IP2location

testsuite.name: Deprecated features for EdgeScape
testsuite.details: These features will be deprecated when weused EdgeScape but will be avaialble when we use ip2location

testcase.name: IP lookup for zip code
testcase.summary:
SPOC – System – IP2Location – Search Data – Search for ZIP code

This feature will not be there for EdgeScape

step.actions:
Go to:

SPOC – System – IP2Location – Search Data
step.expectedresults:
We will not see Serach for: Zip Code

So we will only be seeing Serach for : IP address

step.actions:
Go to:

SPOC – System – IP2Location – Search Data
step.expectedresults:
We will not see Serach for: Zip Code and so we will alos not be able to see Serach Type: Starts with

So we will only be seeing Serach for : IP address

testsuite.name: Login page, to check the country
testsuite.details: Test logging into SPOC coming from different country's and see if it is giving and alert message to user sayingthat he is coming from a different country comapared to the one he logged in from before

testcase.name: Login from diffrerent country
testcase.summary: Login from different country to check the sysetm is recognising the change in country
testcase.preconditions: For test environments as we cannot chnage the country we are coming from we are going to use 10 networ and 43 network to come in from

step.actions: Login into SPOC from 43 network with edgesacpe turned on and into account1
step.expectedresults: Should be able to login

step.actions: Try to login into SPOC from 10 network with edgescape turned on and into account1
step.expectedresults: Should give amessage saying your login country changed

step.actions: On dev environment with edgescape turned on login into account1 from US
step.expectedresults: should be able to login

step.actions: On dev environment with edgescape turned on login into account1 from some other country other than US using a proxy
step.expectedresults: Should give amessage saying your login country changed

testcase.name: Test the handling for private space on dev environment
testcase.summary: Test the handling for private space on dev environmnet

step.actions: On dev environment login into 10 network with account1
step.expectedresults: Should be able to login

step.actions: Login into SPOC dev environment with account1 using US IP or a proxy
step.expectedresults: Should give amessage saying your login country changed

testsuite.name: Additional Search
testsuite.details:
W2P task ID 4668: Additional Search. SPOC version 4.5.0

New search capabilities added:

  • search appdata (service info)
  • search client type(client)
  • search client type defaults(clients)
  • search servers
  • search server list
  • search server groups
  • search software updates/lists/groups (Clients)

testsuite.name: Search App Data
testsuite.details:
Search App Data
( SPOC > Service Info > Services Data > View App Data )

Search App Data link would be provided in View App Data page ( )
Following Search options would be available:
    a. Search by App Data Name
    b. Search by App Data ID
    c. Search by Type

testcase.name: Search by App Data Name Equals
testcase.summary: Search by App Data Name using Equals option

step.actions: login to test spoc with a valid test account
step.expectedresults: Access to SPOC Home page

step.actions: go to Service Info ->View App Data
step.expectedresults: Accessed to "View App Data" page

step.actions: click the link "Search App Data"
step.expectedresults: Accessed to the "Search App Data" page

step.actions: make sure the drop down selection is "App Data Name" (this is by default), and radio selection is "equals", enter "vudu" in the input box
step.expectedresults: A record with App Data Name equals "Vudu" is displayed in the search result table.

step.actions: click the edit icon in the right side of the table.
step.expectedresults: Accessed to the "Edit Service App Data" page, make sure all the values in the input fields are match the data in the search result display table.

step.actions: click "Concel" button from the "Edit Service App Data" page,
step.expectedresults: Page should return to the previous search result page.

step.actions: repeat step 5, change App Data Type to a different value, then clike "Edit Service App Data" button.
step.expectedresults: chech the record has changed the "App Data Type" to the new value

step.actions: repeate step 4 and test the delete icon from the search result page.
step.expectedresults: the rcord should be removed from the database

testsuite.name: Search Client Type
testsuite.details:
Search by client type (Clients)
(SPOC > Clients > Client Types > View Client Types > Search Client TYPES)

Search options would be:

  • search by Client Type Name
  • search by Client Type ID
  • search by Label
  • search by Defaults

step.expectedresults: Access to SPOC Home page

step.expectedresults: Accessed "Search Client Types" page

testsuite.name: Search Software Updates/Lists/Groups
testsuite.details:
SEARCH SOFTWARE UPDATES/LISTS/GROUPS (CLIENTS)

In SPOC > Clients >Software Updates > View Software Updates:

Search Software Updates interface would be provided in View Software Updates Page
Following parameter(s) could be searched:

  • Search by Software Version
  • Search By Update Name
  • Search by Update ID


In SPOC > Clients >Software Updates > View Update Lists
Search Update Lists interface would be provided in VIew Update Lists Page
Following parameter(s) could be searched:

  • Search by Update List Name
  • Search By Assigned Groups
  • Search by Update List ID


In SPOC > Clients >Software Updates > View Update Groups
Search View Update Groups interface would be provided in ViewUpdateGroups Page
Following parameter(s) could be searched:

  • Search by Update List Name
  • Search By Update Group Name
  • Search by Update Group ID

testsuite.name: Disconnect Notificaton
testsuite.details:
Task ID 5701 Force disconnect notification type to ESN

Task ID 5625 SCR 773 Non-BIV device purge

Task ID 5724 Disconnect notification for all esn(s) in customer plus

testcase.name: Verify the signature calculation is correct
testcase.summary:
This test case will verify the disconnect notification post data includes a valid sig when purge a device.

setup the content notification param to esn for a SP that its service in the device's service list, make sure the notification_url and outbound_key are configged for the SP, then purge this device.

To verify the Purge execution, check: spocdb.log_entry and spocdb.extended_log_entry

verify the disconnect notification was sent to that SP.

Check "sig=string" is included in payload_data in spocdb.extended_log_entr
testcase.preconditions: The test device need to be searchable in the test environment, and has a valid IP address.

testsuite.name: Non-BIV Device Purge
testsuite.details:
Task ID 5625 SCR 773 Non-BIV device purge

Extend scope of current disconnect message function to include non biv services. Upon purge request through the existing SPOC interfaces, in addition to purging BIV-related services, SPOC will determine country of prior operation and using that country, preemptively send disconnect message to each Non-BIV SP (using ESN & SIG only) in the associated service list.

(https://web2project.internet.sony.tv/index.php?m=tasks&a=view&task_id=5625 )

testcase.name: Purge Device from Clients-Search Clients
testcase.summary:
There are different ways to purge a device from SPOC: you can purge from Clients ->Search Clients, or from Clients ->Search Customers; you can also di it from the Service -> Purge the device.

This test case is for purge from Clients -> Search Clients. Following is the path to reach the Purge Client page:

Clients->Search Clients ->(click on the device MAC)Summary for Client ->Purge Client

when hit "Purge" button from the "Confirm Purge for Client ..." page , SPOC will

  • See if client has valid IP address. If so get client.country. If client has no IP address client has not connected to SSM server.
  • identify the service list assigned for the client.country;
  • identify all the Services configured in this Service list which has UIB_type set to “Browser”;
  • for each non-BIV service, obtain the Providers information which includes: i.    Configured “notification_url” (SSMDB.providers.notification_url)
    ii.    Configured providers Outbound Key(SSMDB.providers.outbound_key);
  • Create a POST payload data containing the ESN of this device/client and signature, and Send the disconnect/purge notification to this non-BIV service provider

To verify the Purge execution, check: spocdb.log_entry and spocdb.extended_log_entry

verify the disconnect notification was sent to all service providers that have notification URL and outbound_key.
testcase.preconditions: The test device need to be searchable in the test environment, and has a valid IP address. The test device has no curtomer affiliation, i.e. Non-BIV device

testcase.name: Purge Device from Clients-Search Customers
testcase.summary:
There are different ways to purge a device from SPOC: you can purge from Clients ->Search Clients, or from Clients ->Search Customers; you can also do it from the Service -> Purge the device.

This test case is for purge from Clients-> Search Customers. Following is the path to reach the Purge button:

Clients->Search Customers->Summary for Customer->Purge Button

This device has a customer associated with it, so it's BIV device

To verify the Purge execution, check: spocdb.log_entry and spocdb.third_party_sid and third_party_customer_data

verify the disconnect notification was sent to all service providers that have notification URL and outbound_key

make sure remaing_device_count is included in the request URL as a parameter.
testcase.preconditions: The test device need to be searchable in the test environment,  has a valid IP address, and has a customer associated with it.

testcase.name: Purge Device from Service-Purge the Device
testcase.summary:
There are different ways to purge a device from SPOC: you can purge from Clients ->Search Clients, or from Clients ->Search Customers; you can also do it from the Service -> Purge the device.

This test case is for purge from Service -> Purge the device. Following is the path to reach the Purge Client page:

Service->Purge the Device ->Purge

when hit "Purge" button , SPOC will

  • See if client has valid IP address. If so get client.country. If client has no IP address client has not connected to SSM server.
  • identify the service list assigned for the client.country;
  • identify all the Services configured in this Service list which has UIB_type set to “Browser”;
  • for each non-BIV service, obtain the Providers information which includes: i.    Configured “notification_url” (SSMDB.providers.notification_url)
    ii.    Configured providers Outbound Key(SSMDB.providers.outbound_key);
  • Create a POST payload data containing the ESN of this device/client and signature, and Send the disconnect/purge notification to this non-BIV service provider

To verify the Purge execution, check: spocdb.log_entry and spocdb.extended_log_entry

verify the disconnect notification was sent to all service providers that have notification URL and outbound_key.

make sure no remaining_device_count parameter included in the disconnect request URL.
testcase.preconditions: The test device need to be searchable in the test environment, and has a valid IP address. The test device has no curtomer affiliation, i.e. Non-BIV device

testsuite.name: Force disconnect notification type to ESN
testsuite.details:
Task ID 5701 Force disconnect notification type to ESN

We need to add a remaining device count to the disconnect notification for customer plus providers. If a user has disconnected the last device, the remaining device count will be 0, allowing the service provider to make a decision on whether to remove the account on their end. If the device count is not 0, it's an indication that there are still devices on the account so they should retain the account even if they have no notion of the remaining devices.

8/28/2013 - After discussion with Lee and PSI, the description of this task has changed. Here is the original description for reference:Per Lee, we want to start sending ESN only in the disconnect notification to all services. We can remove the setting from SPOC and force the ESN selection. (We should probably leave the logic and the option in the DB in the event we need to make an exception for some reason.)

(https://web2project.internet.sony.tv/index.php?m=tasks&a=view&task_id=5701 )

testsuite.name: Disconnect notification for all esn(s) in customer plus
testsuite.details:
Task ID 5724 Disconnect notification for all esn(s) in customer plus

Currently, we only send a disconnect notification for customer and customer plus services when the last device is purged. This causes a problem for customer plus services that are saving devices with the accounts since they are not notified to remove the device.

We want to change this to send a notice any time a device is purged.

 (https://web2project.internet.sony.tv/index.php?m=tasks&a=view&task_id=5724 )

Related to:

a.       Remove “customer” from affiliation type options:
https://web2project.internet.sony.tv/index.php?m=tasks&a=view&task_id=6300

b.      Force Disconnect Notification Type to ESN
https://web2project.internet.sony.tv/index.php?m=tasks&a=view&task_id=5701

testcase.name: SPOC Client Capabilities
testcase.summary:
SPOC Client Capabilities

1.       Sign in to SPOC (4.5.2a) or latest version

2.       Click on Clients

3.       Click on View Firmware Client capabilities under Product Types

4.       Click on New Firmware Client Capability

New Firmware Client Capabilities

5.       Click on New Firmware client capabilities and verify that it leads to correct page

6.       Test all clickable fields and verify that all leads to correct page

7.       Test all collapse/expand field

8.       Check all other buttons are function correctly

9.       Check that Select all and Deselect all is working correctly for all the Client capabilities.

10.   Verify that we are able to select or deselect items on various Client Capabilities types.

11.   Verify that if we hit create client capabilities we are able to create client capabilities.

12.   Verify that if we hit Cancel it would leads to correct page.

13.   Verify that we are able to select Product ID and product Code from drop down.

14.   Verify that we are able to enter the data in SW build and release date fields

Edit Firmware Client Capabilities

1.       Verify that if we click on edit the Firmware Client capabilities it would leads to Edit Firmware client Capabilities page and able to edit the fields.

2.       Check that Select all and Deselect all is working correctly for all the Client capabilities.

3.       Verify that we are able to select or deselect items on various Client Capabilities types.

4.       Verify that if we hit Edit client capabilities we are able to save all the changes

5.       Verify that if we hit Cancel it would leads to correct page.

Copy Firmware Client Capabilities

1.        Verify that if we click on Copy the Firmware Client capabilities it would leads to Copy Firmware client Capabilities page.

2.       Verify that if we hit Copy client capabilities we are able to copy all the Capabilities type from the one we are copying.

3.       Verify that if we hit Cancel it would leads to correct page.

 

Search Firmware Client Capabilities

1.        Verify that if we click on Search Firmware Client capabilities it would leads to Search Firmware client Capabilities page.

2.       Verify that if we are able to select various items like Product Code,Product ID, platform SW Build from drop down.

3.       Verify that we are able to select various options like equals,starts with,ends with and contains.

4.       Verify that if we click on Search Firmware Client capabilities it gave us all the search results.

Delete Firmware Client Capabilities

1.        Verify that if we click on Delete Firmware Client capabilities it would delete that Firmware client Capabilities.

2.       Verify after deleting it also deletes from Database.
